title: LIVE: Dangerous storms just a few hours from hitting the Wiregrass
excerpt: WDHN will keep the livestream in the player above going throughout Saturday afternoon with a constantly updating radar and our meteorologists will give...

html:
WDHN will keep the livestream in the player above going throughout Saturday afternoon with a constantly updating radar and our meteorologists will give regular live updates!

DOTHAN, Ala (WDHN) — A Level 4 risk of severe weather remains in effect for all of the Wiregrass as a tornado outbreak looks likely across the state.

Damaging winds, large hail, and violent tornadoes are all possible as we get into the evening and overnight hours.

They are not any current watches and warnings in effect for our area at this time but that will likely change in the next 6-8 hours.

Storms could arrive as early as 9 p.m. and last through around 3-4 a.m.

If you live in a mobile or manufactured home, it is very important that you stay with someone who has a house or apartment with a solid foundation. Tornadoes can easily pick up and throw trailers, RV’s, and manufactured homes and could increase the likelihood of death.

Several shelters have announced they will be open ahead of the storms Saturday evening.

More safe havens opening around the Wiregrass as severe weather threat increases

For the latest news, weather, sports, and streaming video, head to WDHN - wdhn.com.
